greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 1/(1+1/(1+2/(1+3/(1+4/(1+5/(1+...)))))).
comment: Term of Ramanujan's formula (see A059444 and A060196).
reference: S. R. Finch, "Mathematical Constants", Cambridge, pp. 423-428.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
formula: Equals sqrt(Pi*e/2)*erfc(1/sqrt(2)), where erfc is the complementary error function. - _Daniel Forgues_, Apr 14 2011
Also equals Integral_{-infinity..infinity} (1/sqrt(2*Pi))*exp(-x^2/2)/(1+x^2) dx, where the integrand is normal PDF times Cauchy PDF. - _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 28 2015
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Jun 21 2005
